title: smtp failure
content: Just recently, I'm having trouble sending emails through Thunderbird. Receiving is fine. I have not made any changes to settings but I get smtp error when trying to send. I have 3 accounts and my gmail one works but not the other 2. The only difference I can see is the 2 that aren't working are POP3 whereas the gmail one is IMAP but surely that only affects receiving, not sending? Very occasionally an unsent email has miraculously been sent but mostly I get the smtp error. I checked with my ISP and they found not errors and suggested online webmail. Messages send fine through there but I'd rather use Thunderbird. Any suggestions please?

title: Thunderbird detected a potential security threat and did not continue to localhost.
content:
Been using TB to check my gmail account for last few years, been working great. Then I had to update the Authentication method to OAuth2. Ended up having to delete the gmail account from TB, then come back & add it.

Now I can't add it, keep getting the following error message once I click on "Allow" button on Google screen saying "Mozilla TB Email wants to access your Google Account": "Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead Thunderbird detected a potential security threat and did not continue to localhost. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details."

I have disabled Microsoft Defender & disabled my VPN (note: gmail worked just fine before with both of them enabled). Current Version: 115.13.0 (32-bit) Still cannot get past the above error message. I'm at a loss, don't know what else to do, can someone help me get my gmail account reinstalled on TB... How can I trace this problem out... Thank you.

Please use an E-mail reader that supports POP3 with UTF-8 (see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6856.html).

This can also happen when the sender's E-mail program does not correctly format the sent message.

The original message is included as a separate attachment so that it can be downloaded manually.

title: ¿Por qué las cuentas de Outlook buscan correos nuevos al iniciar Thunderbird pese a tenerlo deshabilitado?
content:
Hola. Trabajo con Thunderbird versión 115.13.0 y lo utilizo para manejar varias cuentas de correo tanto de Outlook como Gmail.

Esta semana recibí varios correos de Microsoft a todas mis cuentas de Outlook advirtiendo que ya no podía seguir utilizando el protocolo POP, y que me obligaban a utilizar IMAP con identificación OAuth2. Al no poder cambiar esto desde "Configuración de la cuenta", me vi obligado a eliminar todas las cuentas de Outlook y volverlas a crear de nuevo automáticamente para que se crearan bajo dicho protocolo y sistema de identificación.

El caso es que a pasar de que tengo configurado que no se busquen correos nuevos al iniciar Thunderbird, ni los busque tampoco mientras el programa está abierto, no respeta mi decisión y se buscan correos nuevos al iniciar y también si llega alguno mientras el programa permanece abierto.

Sin embargo con las cuentas de Gmail no me ocurre esto a pesar de tener el mismo protocolo y sistema de identificación.

Os proporciono una imagen de la configuración de todas mis cuentas.
creator: imnovix

title: How to correct a problem with message filter.
content:
Hi there

I have a probably easy to solve issue that has been causing a lot of headaches of late. Previously, as seen in the screenshot, if I wanted to filter out messages say from "PC-welt" or contained that term, I just needed to type that term in the searchbox shown and immediately all messages with it would automatically be sorted out, without even hitting the search button. One can for example then do a bulk deletion. That screenshot would be showing a list of messages with "pc-welt", say in the senders info or subject.

For some reason I yet do not know, this has ceased happening and in fact as shown, nothing happens at all, even after hitting the search button. Why is this and how can I come back to THIS function? If one uses the "Quich filter", which I DO NOT LIKE, the results are opened in a new tab and not in a form like the preferred option. I do not remember making any Thunderbird filter settings and if I did then unintended. How can I get back to the function of just typing a term, with all results being immediately filtered within that window so I can for example select and delete them?

I have the latest version 115.13.0 (64-bit) (portable)

Thank you in advance.

Similar to [https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1307490], Thunderbird inserts line breaks at a certain interval of which I am not sure the purpose. I had the issue of the first article, so I set mailnews.wraplength to 0 as was suggested, which fixed the line breaks every line, but there are still line breaks every few lines. There are no line breaks in the Thunderbird composer or inbox, the screenshot attached shows how the line breaks appear on all other email clients I have tested (Outlook for desktop in the screenshot, but also Outlook for web, Outlook for Android, Gmail web, Gmail for Android).

title: Lentitud y consumo de recursos en Thunderbird
content:
Estimados

Donde trabajo usamos Thunderbird para gestionar desde el escritorio nuestro correo web, el cual nos entrega el servicio de IMAP. Nuestro problema es que el cliente Thunderbird se ha vuelto muy lento para gestionar los correos, solo para la descarga hace que algunos equipos trabajen a tope y el cliente no deja hacer nada más con él en el momento de descargar correos desde los servidores. Lo he probado sin complementos, pero aun así me da los errores mencionados. Lo que sí, las casillas tienen entre 3 a 20 GB de correos, separados en carpetas por años y empresas o personas. Tomando esto en cuenta, cuanto es lo que puede soportar el cliente. Que puedo hacer para ver una mejora en cuanto a esto... En uno de los usuarios hicimos la prueba con MS OutLook, y la gestión no entrega este inconveniente.

Desde ya, muchas gracias

title: Getting all content in my GMail inbox etc.
content:
Dear Support,

After setting up a new laptop, I have tried to use Thunderbird to download the entire contents of my GMail inbox. When I'm logged into GMail via my Firefox browser, I can see 62,635 messages dating all the way back to July 2008. I installed Thunderbird and created a profile to access my GMail inbox via POP3. Then I set Thunderbird to download new messages. After a few hours, Thunderbird has downloaded 23,485 messages dating back to December 23, 2022. How do I get Thunderbird to retrieve the remaining roughly 40,000 messages all the way back to the first message from August 15, 2008? Can Thunderbird also retrieve messages from GMails Spam folder and drafts folder?

Best regards from Denmark,

Eric

title: Thunderbird error "SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE" but my cert is valid
content:
Hello everyone,

I'm facing a problem with Thunderbird. I have my own mail server that uses an SSL certificate issued by GoDaddy. I checked the certificate and contacted support; they assured me the certificate is valid and not revoked or expired (see OCSP-Check.jpg)*.

However, when I try to configure my account on Thunderbird, it doesn't work. I receive an error stating that the certificate is revoked (see Error-Console.jpg)* and (Error-MSG.jpg).

Disabling the OCSP check allows it to work, but I need to understand why this is happening only in Thunderbird.

I reiterate that it is working normally on Outlook and Android

Some information about my mail server:

Software: Zimbra 8.8.15 OS: Debian APACHE IMAP port: 993 SMTP port: 465 SSL

If you need any further information, I'll be happy to provide it.

Thanks in advance.
creator: ivn.tvrs

title: Thunderbird Updating Function
content:
I went through all my installed software today, with the intentions of cleaning up shop, and opened Thunderbird to see - what the status of the program was.

My installed version is: 91.6.1 I clicked the three bars, "help", and "about Thunderbird" to look for the latest update.

According to my program, Thunderbird is up-to-date - and I am on the "release update channel" - so I checked the website, in-case the program had been permanently cancelled.

I had a similiar problem, with another piece of software - so maybe there is an overlap of some sort.
creator: takecontrolfoundation

title: Hyperlinks in recieved email not opening in Firefox
content: Hi, I have been using T-Bird and Firefox exclusively on Ubuntu since 2014. Periodically, and it seems to coincide with either one of those updating, I have had an ongoing issue with my ability to click on links in my email and have them automatically open my browser (if not already open) or to open in a tab when Firefox is already open. At some point while suffering with this condition it will 'just fix itself' and work sometimes for months or years then do it all over again. I have tried over the years to fix it myself and have read & tried every suggested solution that can be found. I can open my emails in AOL, click on any link and have it open in Firefox. This leads me to believe the problem is with T-bird and not any settings in my browser but just in case I have examined settings in both apps and not found a cause or solution. I have tried every suggested fix in 'config' and have even removed and reinstalled T-bird three different times over the years but to no avail. I really hate having to start over with a new installation especially since it doesn't fix the problem but has caused no end of headaches trying to retrieve my address book and re-customize my email program back to how I like it. PLEASE! Mozilla it's time to fix this ongoing problem that quite obviously plagues so many users out there. I am open to any and all suggested solutions but will be surprised if anyone can suggest something I haven't already tried.
creator: jldevgn
